appropriations: Testimony from the Legal Aid Society of Hawaii supports an additional $1,000,000.00 (HB400_TESTIMONY_JHA_01-30-25_.PDF.txt) increase in the budget line-item for statewide civil legal services. The Legal Clinic supports the current budget of $1.20 (HB400_TESTIMONY_JHA_01-30-25_.PDF.txt) million and an increase of an additional $1.00 (HB400_TESTIMONY_JHA_01-30-25_.PDF.txt) million to support the work of safety net providers in the local community. Volunteer Legal Services Hawai‘i is also pursuing a one million ($1,000,000.00 (HB400_TESTIMONY_JHA_01-30-25_.PDF.txt)) dollar increase in funding for the civil legal services line item for providers.
six_year_fiscal_implications: In addition to the Judiciary's budget request, testimony was submitted supporting an increase for civil legal services. The Legal Aid Society of Hawaii requests an additional $1,000,000.00 (HB400_TESTIMONY_JHA_01-30-25_.PDF.txt) to the line item for legal services. The Legal Clinic supports the current budget of $1.20 (HB400_TESTIMONY_JHA_01-30-25_.PDF.txt) million and an increase of an additional $1.00 (HB400_TESTIMONY_JHA_01-30-25_.PDF.txt) million to the Judiciary’s civil legal services fund.
capital_expenditure_impact: The Judiciary requests CIP bond funds totaling $9.90 (HB400_TESTIMONY_JHA_01-30-25_.PDF.txt) million for FY 2026. This request includes $4.00 (HB400_TESTIMONY_JHA_01-30-25_.PDF.txt) million to design a new South Kohala District Courthouse, $900,000.00 (HB400_TESTIMONY_JHA_01-30-25_.PDF.txt) to replace an A/C chiller on Kaua‘i, and $5.00 (HB400_TESTIMONY_JHA_01-30-25_.PDF.txt) million in lump sum bond funds (HB400_TESTIMONY_JHA_01-30-25_.PDF.txt). The Committee on Judiciary & Hawaiian Affairs requests the Committee on Finance consider authorizing lump sum general obligation bond funds for capital improvement projects for Judiciary facilities to account for the additional cost to relocate the Children's Justice Center (HB400_HSCR286_.PDF.txt).
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The primary updates involve requests from external organizations for increased funding for civil legal services and revised capital expenditure figures from the Judiciary. Multiple testimonies request an additional $1,000,000.00 (HB400_TESTIMONY_JHA_01-30-25_.PDF.txt) for civil legal services, a component not detailed in the prior note. The Judiciary's Capital Improvement Project (CIP) request is now specified as $9.90 (HB400_TESTIMONY_JHA_01-30-25_.PDF.txt) million, which differs from the amount cited in the previous note, and a House committee report recommends considering a larger lump sum for CIP to cover costs to relocate the Children's Justice Center (HB400_HSCR286_.PDF.txt).
